channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Knife attacker kills three after smoke bombing Taiwan metro
item.description: The suspect's spree began at Taipei's main metro before he moved to another station nearby.

item.title: Putin tells BBC Western leaders deceived Russia
item.description: BBC Russia editor Steve Rosenberg had the opportunity to ask Vladimir Putin about his plans for the future of the country.

item.title: Tourists to face €2 fee to get near Rome's Trevi Fountain
item.description: Visitors who don't live in Rome will have to pay to view the Baroque monument up close from February.

item.title: Suspect in Brown University shooting and MIT professor’s killing was once a physics student
Trump reaches deal with 9 major drugmakers to lower prices
item.description: Nine drug manufacturers will offer their drugs to Medicaid recipients at most-favored-nation discounts in exchange for tariff exemptions.

item.title: How one anonymous tipster cracked the Brown University shooting case
CPI report shows the inflation rate rose at a 2.7% pace in November
item.description: Economists had expected CPI to rise at an annual rate of 3% last month.

item.title: Here's how much ACA costs would have risen this year without subsidies
item.description: Millions of people with an Affordable Care Act health plan face a massive jump in premiums next year — this chart shows just how much.

item.title: Charlie Kirk's widow Erika endorses JD Vance for president

item.title: Australia was seen as a world leader in gun control - Bondi has exposed a more complicated reality
item.description: It introduced stricter gun laws after the 1996 Port Arthur massacre, but some say they now need to be tightened further.
